Quinoa is a grain crop with edible seeds, renowned for its hardiness.

It's grown in a variety of climates from
coastal regions in Chile

to over 13,000 feet in the Andes. However
the growing popularity of quinoa in the
Western world has seen its price

triple. In Bolivia and Peru, where qunioa is

and so instead imported junk food is much
cheaper.
Locusts, grasshoppers, spiders, wasps,
worms, ants, and beetles aren't found on your typical western menu.

But thousands of species are eaten across
Africa, Latin America and Asia.

With rising food prices and land shortages,
